title: Soil Test Interpretation | From the Ground Up

tasks.task: Contacting Extension Office for Soil Test Recommendations
subtasks: Determine whether to contact local extension office for yard or garden problems
Inquire about obtaining a soil test if needed for landscape projects
Take soil samples from the yard or garden as per extension office guidelines
Submit collected samples to the extension office for analysis
Receive soil test results indicating basics such as pH, electrical conductivity, lime presence, texture, and nutrient levels
Review results for high salt content or alkaline pH, noting organic matter levels

tasks.task: Amending Soil Based on Test Results
subtasks: For low organic matter, add compost, manure, or other plant material to improve soil quality
Adjust soil composition as necessary based on nutrient deficiencies indicated in test
Recognize importance of Nitrate, Phosphorus, and Potassium for plant growth
Understand how different nutrients (Nitrate, Phosphorus, Potassium) affect plant health and development

tasks.task: Seeking Expert Advice for Result Interpretation
subtasks: Request a copy of the soil test results for detailed analysis from the extension office if needed

tasks.task: Considering Local Extension Office as a Resource
subtasks: Utilize educational resources provided by the University of Wyoming Extension through the "From the Ground Up" series
Follow advice from Donna Hoffman, an extension agent, for home gardening and landscaping
